column6: The Villa is quite big, 4 stories long with 6 bedrooms, kitchen, 3 living rooms, amenities for your staying needs (kitchen utensils, food utensils, laundry utensils, Hair dryer, etc.) and a swimming pool. Every room is clean as well. I really like the view and the atmosphere of the highland. Each room is very spacious, with a king-sized bed and its own bathroom. There's also a mini mart within a walking distance.The guard on duty is very helpful as well, every time I phone them to get help with something, they came immediately. The villa really accommodated our need for stay-cation, and the establishment is family-friendly as well. Me and my friends really enjoyed our stay, and we will definitely come back here for our next stay in Bandung.

So, the story is that I was in installments to put our suitcases and belongings into the car, my wife and child were in a room with a locked door, suddenly a hotel clerk/staff opened the room door with the excuse that he saw that I was carrying my suitcase to the car even though at that time I had not asked the receptionist to check out.

column6: (-) There is no hot shower. Bed damp and lots of stains. The bathroom seemed dirty and worn to the point of yellowing. Good to replace. The room looks dirty, worn and old, when I'm alone. Wouldn't dare, it's a lot of luck. (+) The staff and guard are good and on standby. The glass doors and windows are wide, I like it. There is a play ground for children. Hot water dispenser is provided. Parking is quite spacious. Right beside the hotel there is an eating house and souvenir center. Early in the morning there were horses and sellers of berries.

column6: First time stays at this really central located hotel, we booked the Deluxe City View and asked for the high floor to have a better view, it was really a stunning view from the balcony and window. They gave us the room no 1032, its headed to East (just in front of the Gasibu park) and the side window is headed to North (Dago and Mt Tangkuban Perahu view). The room size is just perfect with large modern IPTV and other facilities but the bathroom size is really small (1x1,5) for a 5* hotel, even the 4* hotel have much bigger bathroom. The other issues is the sound proof is really bad, the noise from the busy street and Gasibu park below is clearly heard in the room and its really dissapointing for a 5* hotel. The parking lots is huge, I guess its the biggest basement parking lot for a hotel in Bandung, maybe its because of next to the hotel is a convention center and they shared the same parking lot, and maybe if there's an event at the convention center then parking will be an issue. Anyway, overall its a pleasent stay at the hotel, and really recommended hotel for leissure or business.

column6: Superb! Clean, hightech, cheap (under IDR 200k), friendly staff, good facilities: wifi, hot water, water dispenser, microwave, prayer room. Althought there's silence hours (21.00-07.00) still I could hear voices. So, you might need to have ear plugs especially for those you are too sensitive to voices. But, I love the idea of natural sound effect and light setting based on our mood on our capsule. Brilliant. Just, a suggestion for those who have problem with weight and steps, you'd better book the earth type not the sky one. Over all, a great experience and would love to come back.

column6: This villa is really rubbish. Dont ever rent here, its all different from the photos. Until there at 7 pm, I was tired of traffic, until the villa turned out to be in this condition. It so happened that my parents stayed without me, and I was not able to be contacted until 10 pm. The villa clerk said that if you buy online, the condition can be maintained, so dont buy through an online agent tomorrow so you can get a good deal. For 3 hours my parents settled the villa until they bought a mop broom. After I could be contacted and I knew the condition, I immediately became angry. Send them out to find another villa, then I contact an online agent. Fortunately online agents are helpful. Right then it was changed to another villa. 11 o'clock at night move the villa. But really disappointed, 4 hours my parents were taking care of the trash villa. The hope is that they will be able to relax and become very peer. Management of the palace villa Bunga Sucks.

column6: At first we just want to relax in the villa but we found out that beside the villa was still under construction that were still very busy and noisy from 7.30am-5pm. Lots of worker wandering around the house and some of them keep looking inside our villa and made us very unsafe and uncomfortable. We booked for 2nights and plan to spend the whole day in the villa but our plan have changed. We have to go out from morning until 5pm just to avoid the noises. My advice is better to check with the host before booking because the house which is under construction is very disturbing and the workers can see inside the villa. There is no AC in the room but they do have a fan in each room but still my kids were sweating when they sleep at night. In the afternoon on the 2nd floor its very warm. They only have 1 TV on the 2nd floor and the place quiet small for all of us (3 adults 3 kids) to fit in with just a small sofa. The capacity for hot water in the bathroom not much and not stable, sometimes we have to wait for few minutes until the hot water out. The best is the fresh air there, the kitchen tools is clean, nice pool with a clean pool water but the water was to cold to swim. Nice and clean living room, good air circulation in the living room and nice place to hangout but unfortunately there is no TV.

column6: Pros: nice valley view from balcony, clean room, standard speed wi-fi cons: we perceive this hotel is actually a guest house and not suitable to be classified as a decent hotel as they only have 3 rooms. It is also located at remote area that require us to drive through an uneven road and small passage (only designed for one way) and quite far from main road. Parking space is limited to max. 3 cars with a confined access. Breakfast is served to the room but based on their very limited menu. No nearby amenities. Room is also sound-leaked as we can easily hear the voices from the other rooms. No tv cable. The hotel only have 2 staffs that served us for everything. Conclusion: this so-called hotel is not recommended to stay at especially with such a high price that doesn't worth our overall poor experience. We are totally disappointed.

column6: Went here for family vacation that practically included 3 families. Everything was great! The rooms were bright and clean. There's a sense of old and untouched items such as cabinets and other furniture. Bed on the top floor was a little creaky and the bed bench was broken (but hey, there's a bed bench, and God knows we don't sit there, so it's still perfect for placing items). The first floor bedroom was a little dingy, but still clean. Hot water was nice, bathroom was roomy. The stove was a little hard to use, but useable anyway. Stocked dining utensils, sufficient cookware. Sofas and chairs are pleasant through and through. TV has nice channels. It isn't actually far from city, but the terrain was a little tricky and it's in very quiet neighbourhood. Which is great if silence is what you want, but can be a tad bothersome for travels (Uber services do willing to go there; it's just the matter of getting there that wants neat Maps guidance). Located in Dago Atas, in November it was cold. There's no available air con or fan, but the air itself was pretty chilly so no complaints here. Ah, bedsheets seemed clean. Some drawings on the first floor were a little unnerving for the baby tho. Also, there's a bit of a stairs to get to the house. Not a problem, but it is a bit scary in the rain. All in all, we all loved this place. So pleasant, and communication with the host is also very easy. Not too steep a price for what we get!

column6: The villa is quite comfortable. There are some plus and minus points. Pluses: 1. The view is good, cold like a valley. 2. The one at the villa is very friendly, makes me want to go back there again. 3. Spacious villa fits 8-10 people. 4. Spacious swimming pool. 5. Complete cooking utensils. Minus: 1. Hot water in the toilet is not always there. 5 minutes there, keep missing. The wait was really long, until half an hour the hot water didn't come out. 2. Due to the rain, many moths and animals entered the room. 3. Place cooking utensils under the stove, it would be nice to use a pedestal to store it (how to store it face down), especially glass, when drunk there is a woody and moist aroma from the storage area. 4. There are no indoor slippers. 5. The pool is deep for small children.

column6: I spent two nights with my parents at Bale Dikara. The villa is located in a residential area but close to some well-known restaurants in Bandung. The room was very clean and the staff were so helpful. The owner was also very friendly and ready to assist. It has complete facilities inside the villa, like toiletries, internet, refrigerator, cooking utensils, etc. Overall, we had a great time staying in Bale Dikara. At first, we really worried about the access as it was so steep but at the end it was still manageable and the owner even offered a help to take us passing the uphill. I will recommend this villa for people who want to stay in a quiet area but still close to Dago street. It was definitely a pleasant stay for my family. Thank you also for the cute plant as a souvenir at the end of our stay. Love all details in this place.

column6: That was an amazing place to heal from the crowded city! BCR has a great view and perfect nature ambiance. I have some oponions for the +/- of staying experience in executive A room. Here we go!(+) sides.- the building is perfectly architectural built with ex-container that has amazing spot to take a photo.-food tasted great. I had breakfast and dinner at the restaurant with good price (around 35-45k for main course) although they have not many variant.-good ambiance, great for healing time. The temperature was pretty cold (15-17 C degrees) at night and personally I need more blanket/heater__.-they served welcoming snack.-having a tracking path (both the short one and they said there is another track to ancient fortress with guidance around 40minutes walk)-they got necessities that standard hotel gives. (toiletries, slipper, towel).(-) sides.-the building seems a bit not well taken care of. They seem short of staff (only 4/5 people do the cooking and laundry at the same time) and you need to wait until they served what you need. They are looking for other employee afterall __. The door of my room doesn't have a key and a lil bit broken, but I've suggested them to fix it asap.- the road to the BCR was perfectly challenging __ its a small road with ups and downs path. The road also awfully damaged so you need to careful with your car. But afterall it was nice stay and for me still 5/5 stars given to them. Thanks BCR!

column6: A pleasant stay in the middle of bandung. I booked the single room with a bathtub (required prior request) and the room exterior feels like an aged homey place. The hot water is available on specific times (5-9; 15-21), the bathtub drain plug is not available (you had to bring/make your own), the air conditioning remote required extra aim to be able to function. The bed was alright, it has one pillow. The exterior is well-maintained, a lot of breathing space and great gardens. This hotel has a "kamartuju" cafe which serves great ristresso and affogato, a must try. On weekend this is a bicycling spot where locals meet up so expect to see them on the cafe at 6-9 am. Didn't book with breakfast so cannot review the restaurant, but had own breakfast in the place and its very cozy. Lots of ventilation and morning breeze. The gate to jl gempol is not opened anymore which is unfortunate, but may be a required thing in these pandemic times. Weekend morning at jl gempol is very crowded nowadays. Overall a nice place for families to stay, would stay again.

The receptionist (more like a security) said he has no idea about traveloka, he just there to give the room key and the are no other room left except the twin room. I have no choice because it's late at night. When I enter the room, it's a bit damp smell. 2. No wifi + tv cable. TV with no clear channel and only local channel. 3  Toiletries: no tootbrush+paste 4. column6:
Plan to visit Bandung this time was only to accompany and drop our daughter and her friends for a few days vacation, after dropping the kids to the hotel we planned to go straight back to Jakarta, but during the trip we saw road to Jakarta was traffics jammed so we decided to stay with our daughter in the same hotel.
Check-in process is very easy since previously we didn't do pre-book. The hotel locations is quite strategic, quite close to the shopping area, there are many restaurants surrounding the hotel, there are also many giant trees that make it very shady along the roads and it’s make us more interesting for morning walk to explore the access to the pedestrians along the road.
There is a car park in front of the hotel and basement, in my opinion the room price is quite cheap, the receptionist is very friendly, the lobby is not too wide but I feel at home sitting for a long time in the lobby.
On the left side there is a Magenta coffee shop which also functions as a breakfast place, room we chose was not too big but more than enough for a rest, there is also swimming pool on the top roof were not too big but sufficient hotel guests.
Doesn’t have many menu choices for breakfast menu but in my opinion it's more enough with the hotel rate we paid.
Finally thanks all for the hospitality and keep your best customer success __

column6: Pemandangannya sangat indah. Benar-benar pengalaman yang menyenangkan menginap di tengah hutan dengan suasana yang tenang. Benar-benar refreshing yang sangat menyegarkan. Anak-anak sangat suka karena bisa berpetualang. Kami juga tenang membiarkan anak-anak berpetualang karena lokasi aman. Anak-anak juga senang karena disediakan api unggun di malam hari sesuai permintaan. Sarapannya juga enak dan bisa diantar ke villa. Staff nya sangat ramah dan helpful. Hampir semua staff jika berpapasan selalu memberi salam, menyapa, dan tersenyum. Namun saya tidak menyangka, dengan level resort dan harga yang tidak murah, ternyata tidak ada fasilitas handuk, sendal dalam, kopi, teh, dan lain-lain. Dengan cuaca yang sangat dingin, hingga mencapai 17°c, selimut yang disediakan sangat tipis sekali. Harusnya minimal setebal bed cover. Overall. Sangat menyenangkan menginap di sini. Semoga fasilitas kamarnya bisa ditingkatkan agar pengalaman menginap lebih nyaman.

column6: The first time the road to this hotel is indeed a bit up and down because it is in Lembang. There are several containers similar to the costay but identical is that the costay is red. The room is clean complete with ac and hot shower that relies on solar power. Well, if it is cloudy and rainy, the hot water will be less hot. Food facilities are not yet available but finding food is not difficult or if you want you can bring it yourself. When the night is very cold, we turn off the air conditioner because it is so cold. It & apos; s just comfortable, it & apos; s just that it is a little less soundproof There is only bath soap available in the room where I got no shampoo, maybe the person forgot. The TV is also digital, you can watch YouTube for children. The swimming pool is also clean only the water is really cold hehehe. Refill water facility is near the garage. The service is also very friendly, the people are really helpful and fun to chat with. My suggestion is that it is better if each room is given its own tissue holder. That's all, the rest we all feel comfortable living here. Next time will come back again.

column6: I had high expectations with Bobobox, and let me tell you this: Bobobox DID meet my expectations! I am very pleased with my stay. Never have I ever thought that sleeping in a private, secluded box would make me feel that refreshed and relaxed. I was grateful that I booked the double sky pod all for myself though, it was spacious for someone with a small figure like I am. I love how cold the pod was and how comfortable the bed was. Since I booked the sky one, it kind of made me feel a little bit adventurous, which I enjoyed. The bathroom was clean and thankfully not that far away from my pod. The warm water just hit different when I took a bath in the cold morning of Bandung. The communal space was okay, not that crowded and packed with people-again, which I enjoyed. So, the conclusion is: I am definitely going back. Sooner than I think I will, I guess. Thank you, Bobobox <3.

column6: We stay for 2 nights, stay in room 627. The room is small however its very comfortable and cozy, even though small its accommodate our stay perfectly. The Covid19 protocols really applicable in Hotel, they have Hand Sanitizer almost everywhere, in Hotel public area you must wear mask all the time except when you having breakfast. They have some games in the lobby that really fun, some of the staff could play with you and they challenge the guest in pool table, if the guest won against the staff then you get a free beverage. The cleanliness is good, All staffs is friendly and helpful, and they very informative with the guests need. They have gym, its small and need more equipment to accommodate guests workout. Too bad when we stay, the rooftops restaurant & Bar is under renovation. But this is great & comfortable hotel to stay in Bandung, the location is really strategic. We will stay there again if we going to Bandung, and hopefully we can enjoy the Rooftops Bar & restaurant.

column6: His intention was to make a staycation on his parents' birthday, it was really sad that it was remembered as bad memories. The room is not clean, the glass still has dirt from previous use which is not clean when washed, the extra bed has an area that smells of baby spit, there is a menu in the room (contacted via whatsapp was not answered until I went to the receptionist who turned out to be the reception staff playing games on my cellphone) but he said that the one selling it was closed and I was given a screenshot of the menu in the grab application which I finally ordered without going through the staff who guarded the receptionist and finally the private pool that was most targeted from the start turned out to be useless because the water wasn't hot at all and the color was very cloudy Even so, the chocolate plus the water in the public pool is not hot. Honestly, it's really bad feelings from the check-in process, my family has always been on staycations and this is indeed the first bad experience we've had while booking a hotel, until our family doesn't want to take a shower at this hotel because it's so uncomfortable to see the water is cloudy like that. There's only one thing that my family can appreciate, namely the staff who fixed the tv as well as anter the extra bed because he was friendly and helpful, basically thank you very much for the unforgettable experience! .

column6: The building is very nice, very aesthetic, plus the air is very fresh and cold, making this villa suitable for use as a staycation/vacation with family. In addition, there are carpet facilities that make us less cold when we set our feet on the floor. But unfortunately, the facilities and buildings that are owned are not well cared for. Natural hot water flowing from a private bathing pool, the water is not clear, and contains a lot of soil / moss. Maybe if the management could be more careful in looking at business opportunities, for this hot water channel it could be given a filter, so that the water that comes out does not contain soil/moss considering the price of lodging is also not cheap. In addition, the water in the shower for rinsing also doesn't work, maybe it can be replaced with a new one if the shower is damaged. Mossy bathroom walls may also be rejuvenated by repainting, to be more comfortable when used. For the toilet itself, the flush doesn't work, but a bucket and a dipper are provided to collect water from a small faucet, so that when used, you can use a bucket and a dipper to flush. In addition, the first time I entered the room, the bed linen was still dirty, it seemed that someone had used it before but the room had not been cleaned, just tidied it up without changing the sheets. Then the floor is still sticky and dirty. And a lot of flies in the room (he said because it was the rainy season), the solution could actually be to ask for insect spray. So not too much of a problem. Just for info only. So I had to intervene myself to clean the room and spray insect repellent to repel flies, and asked the cleaners to change the sheets. The drinking water facilities are very good, I did not touch the stove and cutlery facilities, because I was disappointed with the untidy and less clean rooms. For food, actually there is only a menu provided in the room, but if you want to order food we have to ask for the WA number from one of the people at the reception, and that makes me lazy to go back and forth, because when I checked in I was not informed of this. Therefore I do not use the facility to buy food through the menu, so I can't review what the food is like. Suggestions should be besides the menu, include a phone number to order food, so that tenants don't bother having to go back and forth to the receptionist. Or if possible, room telephone facilities are provided, because if we have a complaint, it's a bit troublesome, we have to go up and down to the receptionist, especially if the weather is raining all day. Hopefully the cleanliness and tidiness can be further improved, especially for hot water in the bathroom, please fix it. Because it is very unfortunate with all the facilities and the shape of this very good building, so it is abandoned and not cared for. This review is not meant to be dropped, hopefully it can be used to improve facilities, considering the pity for the tenants who have come from far away from the city when they see the current condition of the inn which is very different from the one in the picture. Moreover, the rental price is quite decent in my opinion. Thank you.

column6: I am actually impressed by the facilities they’re giving. We were arrived in the afternoon and welcomed by a very nice receptionist. I booked a Studio Double Room, they have sink, microwave, mineral water in dispenser, coffee & tea, refrigerator, tv and a couch, (not to forget the comfy bed). And its very spacious for myself alone. The bathroom has a bathtub and separated shower (which is really nice), they provide a shampoo & liquid soap, and also towels. But they do not provide toothbrush and toothpaste, (which is actually okay for me, because I always bring mine) but in case you don’t have it with you, buy one travel toothbrush and toothpaste, it won’t be expensive anway. The location, it is located nearby the ITB University. So do not have to be worry about food, you’ll find plenty around the area. Everything in this place is great. Just a little note that the parking lots is limited, so you might park outside the building on busy days (but it is safe tho, I parked mine outside too at the time). And also if you’re planning to go outside or come back to the hotel / guesthouse a little late, you might need to let the receptionist or the keeper know before you leave. So that you won’t locked outside like I experienced. Long story short, it’s all good with a little notes here and there. Enjoy your stay!

column6: The place was really peaceful and clean, service was really good and the food was top notch ____ However there are couple things to note: 1. Since it's basically out of nowhere, there will be a lot of bees at night so be sure to close all the sliding doors before it gets dark. 2. If you're not a morning person you might want to rethink. It gets noisy as you can hear a lot of bugs and animal sounds in the morning hahaha 3. The bench outside is open for public, so don't be alert if you see your neighbors chilling outside your unit __ Otherwise, I had a really great time and wish to come back when the time permits. column6: The staffs are nice but the service is bad. The room is not clean, it ' s dusty and the furnitures are badly maintained. The housekeeping only replaced the the bad sheets, they didn't even clean the room nor bathroom. The AC was not working properly, we had hard time sleeping. Asked them to fix the AC but they did little to nothing. Breakfast was so so. Little parking space. Covid protocol was terrible, most of the guests did not wear any mask in lobby and restaurant. Sad sad stay. We actually booked for Two nights, but only stayed for one, got the second night refunded and moved to a better hotel. It ' s very unfortunate because this hotel used to be very Good. Used to stay here few years ago and it was very pleasing, but not this time. Sad to see what happened to this hotel. In 2016/17 the room here used to cost around $ 70-$100/night now it only costs $ 35, half the price. Judging by that I can clearly say it ' s because of the degradation of quality. Maybe because of pandemic? We'll never know. If you want a pleasant stay for/under $ 50, I suggest look for newer modern hotels to stay like Moxy hotel, hotel 101 or any other budget hotel. They cost almost the same and offer better room and services. Hope this help. Cheers!

column6: The staffs are nice but the service is bad. The room is not clean, it ' s dusty and the furnitures are badly maintained. The housekeeping only replaced the the bad sheets, they didn't even clean the room nor bathroom. The AC was not working properly, we had hard time sleeping. Asked them to fix the AC but they did little to nothing. Breakfast was so so. Little parking space. Covid protocol was terrible, most of the guests did not wear any mask in lobby and restaurant. Sad sad stay. We actually booked for Two nights, but only stayed for one, got the second night refunded and moved to a better hotel. It ' s very unfortunate because this hotel used to be very Good. Used to stay here few years ago and it was very pleasing, but not this time. Sad to see what happened to this hotel. In 2016/17 the room here used to cost around $ 70-$100/night now it only costs $ 35, half the price. Judging by that I can clearly say it ' s because of the degradation of quality. Maybe because of pandemic? We'll never know. If you want a pleasant stay for/under $ 50, I suggest look for newer modern hotels to stay like Moxy hotel, hotel 101 or any other budget hotel. They cost almost the same and offer better room and services. Hope this help. Cheers!

column6:
Plan to visit Bandung this time was only to accompany and drop our daughter and her friends for a few days vacation, after dropping the kids to the hotel we planned to go straight back to Jakarta, but during the trip we saw road to Jakarta was traffics jammed so we decided to stay with our daughter in the same hotel.
Check-in process is very easy since previously we didn't do pre-book. The hotel locations is quite strategic, quite close to the shopping area, there are many restaurants surrounding the hotel, there are also many giant trees that make it very shady along the roads and it’s make us more interesting for morning walk to explore the access to the pedestrians along the road.
There is a car park in front of the hotel and basement, in my opinion the room price is quite cheap, the receptionist is very friendly, the lobby is not too wide but I feel at home sitting for a long time in the lobby.
On the left side there is a Magenta coffee shop which also functions as a breakfast place, room we chose was not too big but more than enough for a rest, there is also swimming pool on the top roof were not too big but sufficient hotel guests.
Doesn’t have many menu choices for breakfast menu but in my opinion it's more enough with the hotel rate we paid.
Finally thanks all for the hospitality and keep your best customer success __

column6: A pleasant stay in the middle of bandung. I booked the single room with a bathtub (required prior request) and the room exterior feels like an aged homey place. The hot water is available on specific times (5-9; 15-21), the bathtub drain plug is not available (you had to bring/make your own), the air conditioning remote required extra aim to be able to function. The bed was alright, it has one pillow. The exterior is well-maintained, a lot of breathing space and great gardens. This hotel has a "kamartuju" cafe which serves great ristresso and affogato, a must try. On weekend this is a bicycling spot where locals meet up so expect to see them on the cafe at 6-9 am. Didn't book with breakfast so cannot review the restaurant, but had own breakfast in the place and its very cozy. Lots of ventilation and morning breeze. The gate to jl gempol is not opened anymore which is unfortunate, but may be a required thing in these pandemic times. Weekend morning at jl gempol is very crowded nowadays. Overall a nice place for families to stay, would stay again.

I stayed on the highest floor (3 i think) we got the smoking room so the view can overlook the outside, we got to see the closest mosque and breath some fresh air. There is a swimming pool-not too big and a gym and karaoke place which is good. The food for breakfast is VERY good, the taste is delicious and the variation is a lot. The staff were very nice, the interior is decent and the price is quite affordable. The quality of the room can be improved, some stuff are dirty and broken. Recommended if you’re on a budget holiday____

column6: First time stays at this really central located hotel, we booked the Deluxe City View and asked for the high floor to have a better view, it was really a stunning view from the balcony and window. They gave us the room no 1032, its headed to East (just in front of the Gasibu park) and the side window is headed to North (Dago and Mt Tangkuban Perahu view). The room size is just perfect with large modern IPTV and other facilities but the bathroom size is really small (1x1,5) for a 5* hotel, even the 4* hotel have much bigger bathroom. The other issues is the sound proof is really bad, the noise from the busy street and Gasibu park below is clearly heard in the room and its really dissapointing for a 5* hotel. The parking lots is huge, I guess its the biggest basement parking lot for a hotel in Bandung, maybe its because of next to the hotel is a convention center and they shared the same parking lot, and maybe if there's an event at the convention center then parking will be an issue. Anyway, overall its a pleasent stay at the hotel, and really recommended hotel for leissure or business.

column6: The first impression to see this villa is its view, very impressive. Mountain View is a feast for the eyes. The villa owner really understands the arrangement of the best spots. The attitude of the villa owner is also very friendly, responsive and kind. The location of the villa is very good and the weather is really cold. Indeed, this villa is very simple, in terms of building, interior and furniture, but with the budget offered, for me everything is sufficient and adequate. Here you can also enjoy processed pure milk directly from farmers, just contact the owner of the villa. There are several processed variants that you can try; Pure cow's milk, tofu and yogurt. The milk is a must try, because it's so fresh. Thank you for the friendly service, hope to see you again.

column6: I was here for my family holiday. We chose the place because it’s located in the middle of the city and close to various popular places. The lobby is nice, when you enter there will be a minimart and café. I stayed on the highest floor (3 i think) we got the smoking room so the view can overlook the outside, we got to see the closest mosque and breath some fresh air. There is a swimming pool-not too big and a gym and karaoke place which is good. The food for breakfast is VERY good, the taste is delicious and the variation is a lot. The staff were very nice, the interior is decent and the price is quite affordable. The quality of the room can be improved, some stuff are dirty and broken. Recommended if you’re on a budget holiday____

column6: Went here for family vacation that practically included 3 families. Everything was great! The rooms were bright and clean. There's a sense of old and untouched items such as cabinets and other furniture. Bed on the top floor was a little creaky and the bed bench was broken (but hey, there's a bed bench, and God knows we don't sit there, so it's still perfect for placing items). The first floor bedroom was a little dingy, but still clean. Hot water was nice, bathroom was roomy. The stove was a little hard to use, but useable anyway. Stocked dining utensils, sufficient cookware. Sofas and chairs are pleasant through and through. TV has nice channels. It isn't actually far from city, but the terrain was a little tricky and it's in very quiet neighbourhood. Which is great if silence is what you want, but can be a tad bothersome for travels (Uber services do willing to go there; it's just the matter of getting there that wants neat Maps guidance). Located in Dago Atas, in November it was cold. There's no available air con or fan, but the air itself was pretty chilly so no complaints here. Ah, bedsheets seemed clean. Some drawings on the first floor were a little unnerving for the baby tho. Also, there's a bit of a stairs to get to the house. Not a problem, but it is a bit scary in the rain. All in all, we all loved this place. So pleasant, and communication with the host is also very easy. Not too steep a price for what we get!

column6: First time stays at this really central located hotel, we booked the Deluxe City View and asked for the high floor to have a better view, it was really a stunning view from the balcony and window. They gave us the room no 1032, its headed to East (just in front of the Gasibu park) and the side window is headed to North (Dago and Mt Tangkuban Perahu view). The room size is just perfect with large modern IPTV and other facilities but the bathroom size is really small (1x1,5) for a 5* hotel, even the 4* hotel have much bigger bathroom. The other issues is the sound proof is really bad, the noise from the busy street and Gasibu park below is clearly heard in the room and its really dissapointing for a 5* hotel. The parking lots is huge, I guess its the biggest basement parking lot for a hotel in Bandung, maybe its because of next to the hotel is a convention center and they shared the same parking lot, and maybe if there's an event at the convention center then parking will be an issue. Anyway, overall its a pleasent stay at the hotel, and really recommended hotel for leissure or business.

column6: This time is our 3rd visit at this hotel. We ordered a hedgehog tent7, when I checked in, I was told that there was no hot water to bath in this tent, I began to feel uncomfortable, how could I take a shower without hot water in cold temperatures for me. When I arrived at the tent, I was disappointed because I saw the condition of the tent and dirty cabinets were not maintained, around the tent was muddy, then the toilet could not be flushed, jet spray could not be used, the toilet door could not be locked, no hotel telephone, access towards the tent the road is still rocky. For me, the tents and facilities they provided were not worth the rent. Fortunately they upgraded our tents with better ones, although using hot water was a challenge. And one more thing I don't like is they chained a monkey and kept a few other monkeys and other animals in a poorly maintained cage. Maybe even better if they don't keep these animals to attract visitors.

column6: The front view of the villa directly onto the lake, friendly employees, complete kitchen utensils, minus the glass, only one is given, but if you ask for it, it will be given. There are many mattresses available plus extra beds, there is a fireplace so if the nights are warm. The outdoor facilities are quite complete, there are flying fox, boats, rafting, canoes, the children like it because there are pickled strawberries so there is no need to go anywhere else. There is also a coffee shop that is open until late at night. We came during fruit season so there were a lot of flies, the name is season, you know, but it's better for each villa to be given a broom or fly glue during fruit season. The rest is ok. It's quite fun vacationing here.

Second disappointment was we need to retrieve our welcome drinks at the 12th floor (I think it ' s a lounge or something). We were tired and we don't have the energy to swing by the lounge just to get our drinks. Third, the parking lot was very very inadequate for a 4 star hotel. However, the food were quite tasty and the staffs at the restaurant and cafe were super nice and helpful.

column6: I had high expectations with Bobobox, and let me tell you this: Bobobox DID meet my expectations! I am very pleased with my stay. Never have I ever thought that sleeping in a private, secluded box would make me feel that refreshed and relaxed. I was grateful that I booked the double sky pod all for myself though, it was spacious for someone with a small figure like I am. I love how cold the pod was and how comfortable the bed was. Since I booked the sky one, it kind of made me feel a little bit adventurous, which I enjoyed. The bathroom was clean and thankfully not that far away from my pod. The warm water just hit different when I took a bath in the cold morning of Bandung. The communal space was okay, not that crowded and packed with people-again, which I enjoyed. So, the conclusion is: I am definitely going back. Sooner than I think I will, I guess. Thank you, Bobobox <3.
